messages.subject: Re: Book Question on Kogai
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks much Jim!  I got thrown by the use of the different names in the same Sotheby catalog.  One listing would be for Ko Kogai, another for Furukogai, etc.
messages.messageBody:
Thanks much Jim! I got thrown by the use of the different names in the
same Sotheby catalog. One listing would be for Ko Kogai, another for
Furukogai, etc. Possibly they had different people doing the
attributions therefore creating an apparent inconsistency.
I wish it was as easy to find a copy of the damn book as it was to find
the answer! LOL It's like trying to pick up a copy of Furukawa's
Collection -- not easy.
Thanks again!

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Question on Kogai
messages.msgSnippet: Pete, Furukogai and Ko-Kogai are the same book, just two different readings.  It s definitely worth getting.  I can t think of a book titled just Kogai. Jim
messages.messageBody:
Pete,
Furukogai and Ko-Kogai are the same book, just two different readings. It's definitely worth getting. I can't think of a book titled just Kogai.

Jim





Jim, Gordon, Alan et.al.; do you know if the book(s) 'Kogai', 'Ko
Kogai' and 'Furukogai' are one in the same? I have been reading some
descriptions from the Sotheby London 9 November 2004 catalog and they
list 'Furukogai' and 'Ko Kogai' as well as the 'Mitokoro Shu' by Ikeda
which I already have. I have been attempting to find research books on
kogai and, although I know they are all difficult to locate, it would
be of great help knowing if there is actually more than one book to be
looking for.
Thanks as always!
Pete Klein
.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Book Question on Kogai
messages.msgSnippet: Jim, Gordon, Alan et.al.;  do you know if the book(s) Kogai , Ko Kogai and Furukogai are one in the same?  I have been reading some descriptions from the
messages.messageBody:
Jim, Gordon, Alan et.al.; do you know if the book(s) 'Kogai', 'Ko
Kogai' and 'Furukogai' are one in the same? I have been reading some
descriptions from the Sotheby London 9 November 2004 catalog and they
list 'Furukogai' and 'Ko Kogai' as well as the 'Mitokoro Shu' by Ikeda
which I already have. I have been attempting to find research books on
kogai and, although I know they are all difficult to locate, it would
be of great help knowing if there is actually more than one book to be
looking for.
Thanks as always!
Pete Klein
